channel.title: Hex Editor?
channel.description: Today at school, my friend told me that the reason he had so much money on my server was that he used a Hex Editor. Right as he was beginning to tell me how he used it, the teacher interrupted us and I forgot to ask him after class. But when I asked him first how he did it, he said he chose a program that was running, which was my client, and linked it with the hex editor and edited a few files and was able to change the item value. First off, what is a hex editor? I have one downloaded on to my computer, I just don't know how to use it. Also, how do you use a hex editor. I geuss I'm just going to have to Jar my client files from now on? :P

item.title: Hex Editor?
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

coldfx69:

thats what i meant.

You said they weren’t the same thing and he just proved you wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Hex Editor?
item.dc:creator: @coldfx69 coldfx69
item.description:
@coldfx69 wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:17, topic:304137”][quote author=coldfx69 link=topic=400366.msg2977105#msg2977105 date=1254351055]

It’s a retarded piece of software like Artmoney and Cheatengine.

No, its not the same thing you don’t know what your talking about. I bet you have never even used a hex editor before.
[/quote]Accusations?

[quote author=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hex_editor]By using a hex editor, a user can see or edit the raw and exact contents of a file as opposed to the interpretation of the same content that other, higher level application software may associate with the file format. For example, this could be raw image data, in contrast to the way image editing software would interpret the same file.
In most hex editor applications the data of the computer file is represented as hexadecimal values grouped in 4 groups of 4 bytes and one group of 16 ASCII characters, non-printable characters are typically represented by a dot (".") in the ASCII dump.[/quote]

Artmoney is a program that searches the hex address for you, and with process of elimination it changes exactly what a hex editor changes. The actual value pertaining to the files containing it isn’t changed because it isn’t linked to the server files, but the “characters” representing the value in which the input is searched upon.[/quote]

thats what i meant.

Read full topic

In most hex editor applications the data of the computer file is represented as hexadecimal values grouped in 4 groups of 4 bytes and one group of 16 ASCII characters, non-printable characters are typically represented by a dot (".") in the ASCII dump.[/quote]

Artmoney is a program that searches the hex address for you, and with process of elimination it changes exactly what a hex editor changes. The actual value pertaining to the files containing it isn’t changed because it isn’t linked to the server files, but the “characters” representing the value in which the input is searched upon.[/quote] I remember art money when I was searching for Club Penguin Hax. It was used to change text on sites and shit.

item.title: Hex Editor?
item.dc:creator: @coldfx69 coldfx69
item.description:
@coldfx69 wrote:

You cant hack with hex-editors, because their function is to edit text that is in the .exe not actually editing what the memory stores. Mainly, hex editors are used to leech private servers, for example i know for GunZ servers, people use a hex editor to change the ip the client connects to and also the title. Your friend probably meant a cheat engine. To hack runescape though you would need to hook winsock to force packets to be sent to their server. Anyway, still very hard because Jagex has something that verifies packets.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 30, 2009, 04:57:41 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Kihomura, post:14, topic:304137”]It’s a retarded piece of software like Artmoney and Cheatengine.[/quote]

No, its not the same thing you don’t know what your talking about. I bet you have never even used a hex editor before.

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

He’s obviously pulling you. He probably just dupped the cash, and he’s making some excuse that sounds smart on how he got all of it. If he has no clue what he’s doing, then he most likely doesn’t even know what a hex editor does. He probably just heard about it on youtube or from other scammers. He’s not 1337 at all, he’s a fake.

He actually asked me to start teaching him Java the other day b/c he wants to start a rsps and I volunteered to lend him my work to “leech” off of

item.description:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:3, topic:304137”]He traded me and it was the same amount though[/quote]Idk wtf it was then… Because Hex editors only edit the hex colors and manipulate the image, not the value within the server.

item.title: Hex Editor?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

People used this so scam people on runescape via youtube videos. It doesn’t really change the value, just the image on the client. What it does, is takes the value that you put into the hex editor, the hex editor reads it, and it manipulates the number on the actual client to a different number. The thing is, if you spend any of it, it doesn’t value to the actual amount you changed it to. It just changes the number, not the actual amount you have.

Read full topic
